issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
DASManager should ensure database resources are released on all paths in cleanVolume. Allocation stack:

{code}
com.eucalyptus.system.Threads.currentStackString(Threads.java:628)	
com.eucalyptus.entities.Entities$TxRecord.<init>(Entities.java:1451)	
com.eucalyptus.entities.Entities$CascadingTx.<init>(Entities.java:1182)	
com.eucalyptus.entities.Entities.createTransaction(Entities.java:234)	
com.eucalyptus.entities.Entities.get(Entities.java:261)	
com.eucalyptus.entities.Entities.transactionFor(Entities.java:400)	
com.eucalyptus.blockstorage.DASManager$VolumeMetadataManager.<init>(DASManager.java:768)	
com.eucalyptus.blockstorage.DASManager.cleanVolume(DASManager.java:277)	
com.eucalyptus.blockstorage.async.FailedVolumeCleaner.cleanVolume(FailedVolumeCleaner.java:127)	
com.eucalyptus.blockstorage.async.FailedVolumeCleaner.run(FailedVolumeCleaner.java:111)	
java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)	
java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.runAndReset(FutureTask.java:308)	
java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.access$301(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:180)	
java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:294)	
java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)	
java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
{code}

This can impact other storage checker tasks.

To reproduce you may need to have volumes in the failed state.
fields.summary: DASManager.cleanVolume does not always release database connection

comments.body:
For verification purposes volume state will have to be modified outside eucalyptus

# Setup a cloud with DAS EBS provider and create a volume
# Look for the corresponding lv (logical volume) on SC. {{lvdisplay}} will list all available lvs. lv name should contain euca-vol-xyz
{noformat}
# lvdisplay /dev/vg01/euca-vol-4353041e
  --- Logical volume ---
  LV Path                /dev/vg01/euca-vol-4353041e
  LV Name                euca-vol-4353041e
  VG Name                vg01
  LV UUID                06VftQ-cGcI-bIiE-tPQe-TdAG-Ihe0-I4dNlh
  LV Write Access        read/write
  LV Creation host, time c-12.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com, 2016-05-06 14:13:24 -0700
  LV Status              available
  # open                 0
  LV Size                1.00 GiB
  Current LE             32
  Segments               1
  Allocation             inherit
  Read ahead sectors     auto
  - currently set to     4096
  Block device           253:2
{noformat}
# Remove the lv
{noformat}
# lvremove -f /dev/vg01/euca-vol-4353041e
{noformat}
# Login to the database on the CLC and update the status of the volume to 'failed'
{noformat}
# psql -p 8777 -h /var/lib/eucalyptus/db/data eucalyptus_shared
psql (9.2.8)
Type "help" for help.

eucalyptus_shared=# set search_path TO eucalyptus_storage;
SET

eucalyptus_shared=# select * from volumes where volume_name='vol-4353041e';
                id                |   creation_timestamp    |  last_update_timestamp  |          metadata_perm_uuid          | version |       create_time       | deletion_time | sc_name | size | snapshot_id |  status   | volume_user_name | volume_name  | zone 
----------------------------------+-------------------------+-------------------------+--------------------------------------+---------+-------------------------+---------------+---------+------+-------------+-----------+------------------+--------------+------
 8aef81af547fb203015487eafb6800a7 | 2016-05-06 14:13:24.584 | 2016-05-06 14:13:24.812 | 4e52dd82-9211-4146-a1c7-ec788c6240d7 |       1 | 2016-05-06 14:13:24.584 |               | one     |    1 |             | available |                  | vol-4353041e | 
(1 row)

eucalyptus_shared=# update volumes set status='failed' where volume_name='vol-4353041e';
UPDATE 1

eucalyptus_shared=# select * from volumes where volume_name='vol-4353041e';
                id                |   creation_timestamp    |  last_update_timestamp  |          metadata_perm_uuid          | version |       create_time       | deletion_time | sc_name | size | snapshot_id | status | volume_user_name | volume_name  | zone 
----------------------------------+-------------------------+-------------------------+--------------------------------------+---------+-------------------------+---------------+---------+------+-------------+--------+------------------+--------------+------
 8aef81af547fb203015487eafb6800a7 | 2016-05-06 14:13:24.584 | 2016-05-06 14:13:24.812 | 4e52dd82-9211-4146-a1c7-ec788c6240d7 |       1 | 2016-05-06 14:13:24.584 |               | one     |    1 |             | failed |                  | vol-4353041e | 
(1 row)
{noformat}
# A duty cycle that runs every 2 minutes on the SC will try to clean up the failed volume, the following messages can be observed in the SC logs if the log level is at DEBUG. 
{noformat}
2016-05-06 14:43:17 DEBUG 000001011 FailedVolumeCleaner      | Cleaning failed volume vol-4353041e
2016-05-06 14:43:17 DEBUG 000001011 SystemUtil               | Running command: //usr/lib/eucalyptus/euca_rootwrap lvdisplay /dev/vg01/euca-vol-4353041e
2016-05-06 14:43:17 DEBUG 000001011 SystemUtil               | Running command: //usr/lib/eucalyptus/euca_rootwrap lvremove -f /dev/vg01/euca-vol-4353041e 
2016-05-06 14:43:17 ERROR 000001011 SystemUtil               | com.eucalyptus.util.EucalyptusCloudException:   Failed to find logical volume "vg01/euca-vol-4353041e"
com.eucalyptus.util.EucalyptusCloudException:   Failed to find logical volume "vg01/euca-vol-4353041e"

        at edu.ucsb.eucalyptus.util.SystemUtil.run(SystemUtil.java:223)
        at edu.ucsb.eucalyptus.util.SystemUtil.run(SystemUtil.java:193)
        at com.eucalyptus.blockstorage.LVMWrapper.removeLogicalVolume(LVMWrapper.java:133)
        at com.eucalyptus.blockstorage.DASManager.cleanVolume(DASManager.java:284)
        at com.eucalyptus.blockstorage.async.FailedVolumeCleaner.cleanVolume(FailedVolumeCleaner.java:127)
        at com.eucalyptus.blockstorage.async.FailedVolumeCleaner.run(FailedVolumeCleaner.java:111)
        at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.runAndReset(FutureTask.java:308)
        at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.access$301(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:180)
        at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:294)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}
# Back to the database on the CLC, 'deletion_time' column in the volumes table should be updated indicating that the volume has been cleaned up
{noformat}
eucalyptus_shared=# select * from volumes where volume_name='vol-4353041e';
                id                |   creation_timestamp    |  last_update_timestamp  |          metadata_perm_uuid          | version |       create_time       |      deletion_time      | sc_name | size | snapshot_id | status | volume_user_name | volume_name  | zone 
----------------------------------+-------------------------+-------------------------+--------------------------------------+---------+-------------------------+-------------------------+---------+------+-------------+--------+------------------+--------------+------
 8aef81af547fb203015487eafb6800a7 | 2016-05-06 14:13:24.584 | 2016-05-06 14:43:17.632 | 4e52dd82-9211-4146-a1c7-ec788c6240d7 |       2 | 2016-05-06 14:13:24.584 | 2016-05-06 14:43:17.631 | one     |    1 |             | failed |                  | vol-4353041e | 
(1 row)
{noformat}
# In addition, the stack trace in the description should no longer be logged since the database transactions are properly closed
I am seeing the database connections being released, the deletion time being updated and the stack trace output as described above.
